timeline.subject: Claudon Marchal du Vivier
timeline.details: Denounced by Laurence femme Vincent Bandesapt, de Pajaille

timeline.subject: Claudon Marchal du Vivier
timeline.details: Denied all charges, said he had never made threats despite quarrels

timeline.subject: Claudon Marchal du Vivier
timeline.details: No reproaches against witnesses, but denial of all relevant charges

timeline.subject: Claudon Marchal du Vivier
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture

timeline.subject: Claudon Marchal du Vivier
timeline.details: Withstood thumbscrews and rack, then given tortillons and made to drink holy water; confessed

timeline.subject: Claudon Marchal du Vivier
timeline.details: Confirmed earlier confessions, named additional accomplices

timeline.subject: Claudon Marchal du Vivier
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to death sentence

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Marchal du Vivier to Catherine veuve Nicolas Menurgier
notable_quotes.french: avoit esté un grand sot de se laisser apprehender, que de sa part s'il scavoit qu'on ayt deliberé de l'apprehender, il n'attenderoit qu'il soit pris, ains seroit filés
notable_quotes.english: had been a great fool to let himself be arrested, that for his part if he knew they had deliberated to arrest him, he would not wait to be taken, but would be gone
notable_quotes.context: About Jean Caillerey during his trial, 3 months before Claudon's own arrest

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine veuve Nicolas Menurgier
notable_quotes.french: elle prioit au bon dieu que tous les sorciers et sorcieres soient bruslés
notable_quotes.english: she prayed to the good God that all witches male and female be burned
notable_quotes.context: Her response to Claudon's comment about Caillerey

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon's son Colas (via witness 8)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il l'auroit ou bien le diable l'auroit
notable_quotes.english: that he would have him or the devil would have him
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Curien after quarrel about horses in forbidden area

notable_quotes.speaker: Wife of Claudon Marchal (via witness 3)
notable_quotes.french: mais que cela luy cousteroit ou vauldroit
notable_quotes.english: but that it would cost her or be worth it
notable_quotes.context: When asked to pay a debt in 3 days

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Marchal du Vivier (via witness 15)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il s'en alloit jouer de par le diable
notable_quotes.english: that he was going to play by the devil
notable_quotes.context: While playing quilles, before knocking down four pins

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Marchal du Vivier (via witness 15)
notable_quotes.french: que beaucoup de porcs se mouroyent audit vilaige, mais qu'il en mourroit encor bien d'avantage
notable_quotes.english: that many pigs were dying in the village, but that many more would die
notable_quotes.context: Previous winter when pigs were dying

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Marchal du Vivier (interrogation)
notable_quotes.french: mais pour leger suject, et neantmoins il s'a tellement contregardé, que jamais il ne luy est arrive donner aucune menasse pour ledit faict de sorcelerie
notable_quotes.english: but for minor subjects, and nevertheless he had so guarded himself that he never made any threats regarding witchcraft
notable_quotes.context: When asked about quarrels during interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Marchal du Vivier (interrogation)
notable_quotes.french: il seroit sorcier sans le scavoir, et que s'il se treuve convaincu de ce crime, nous pourrons dire hardiment que c'est le plus fin sorcier qui soit jamais esté, par ce qu'il ne se trouvera que jamais il ayt usé d'aulcune menasse, nonobstant toutes les disputes qu'il a heu
notable_quotes.english: he would be a witch without knowing it, and that if he is found convicted of this crime, we can boldly say that he is the cleverest witch that has ever been, because it will not be found that he ever made any threat, notwithstanding all the disputes he has had

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Marchal du Vivier (interrogation)
notable_quotes.french: mais vouloit aller chercher meilleur pain que de froment
notable_quotes.english: but wanted to go seek better bread than wheat
notable_quotes.context: Explaining why he thought of selling goods and leaving

economic_context.details: Multiple witnesses complained about overcharging for blacksmith work (shoeing horses). Accused competed unsuccessfully for position as village herdsman. Owed buckwheat debt to Jean Aulbry. Wife was asked to pay debt by Epnon. Multiple disputes over payment for services. Mentioned thinking of selling property and fleeing when arrests were made at Etival.

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a comprehensive trial record with extensive witness testimony. Key features: (1) Male accused, unusual as most Lorraine trials involved women. (2) Accused was a blacksmith - most economic disputes related to his trade (overcharging for shoeing horses). (3) Multiple witnesses report wolf attacks on livestock, which accused allegedly caused through witchcraft - important pattern for understanding animal predation and witchcraft attribution. (4) Accused explicitly denied ever making threats, claiming he would be 'the cleverest witch ever' if guilty because of this. (5) Strong economic competition theme: failed bid for herdsman position, lost customers to other blacksmith, multiple payment disputes. (6) Mother also reputed a witch, had left village. (7) Confession only under torture after withstanding thumbscrews and rack. (8) Named 5 accomplices including people from Pajaille. (9) Change de Nancy consulted twice and approved both torture and execution. (10) Trial duration 11 days from informations to execution - relatively quick. (11) Witness 9's testimony about cure using 'semence d'ornelle' from accused's wife is interesting - suggests accused's family had reputation for both harmful and healing magic. (12) Multiple incidents of wolves that refused to release prey even with burning sticks - vivid detail suggesting supernatural control.
